alert.note: Alert for Livingston; Northern Tangipahoa; Northwest St. Tammany; Southern Tangipahoa (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 03 at 3:23PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern St. Tammany, east central Livingston and southern Tangipahoa Parishes through 400 PM CST... At 322 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Springfield, or 10 miles south of Hammond, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hammond, Ponchatoula, Folsom, Springfield, Natalbany, Robert, Killian and Tickfaw. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 12 between mile markers 37 and 50. Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 19 and 32. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If on or near Lake Maurepas, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.

area.areaDesc: Livingston; Northern Tangipahoa; Northwest St. Tammany; Southern Tangipahoa
